messages.title: Longstanding Conservatives feel left behind by the direction of their party...
messages.content: As we head to the polls this week in the most crucial general election for decades, I want to ask you to consider supporting the Liberal Democrats. I joined the Conservative Party in the 1990s. I was a Minister in Boris Johnson's government, but I quit on a point of principle earlier this year. Leaving the Conservative Party was not easy, but it was the right thing to do. The Conservative Party no longer has a place for people like me.

Boris Johnson cares more about himself than the future of our country; he has lied to people, lied to Parliament and lied to the Queen. He has led his party to the extreme. The Conservative Party has drifted away from One Nation values and towards English nationalism.
A vote for Boris Johnson’s party is essentially a vote for Nigel Farage and the Brexit Party.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Boris Johnson, Nigel Farage, Jeremy Corbyn

issues.brexitEurope: A vote for Boris Johnson’s party is essentially a vote for Nigel Farage and the Brexit Party.
issues.governance: Boris Johnson cares more about himself than the future of our country; he has lied to people, lied to Parliament and lied to the Queen.

leaflet.personalStatement: This is a crucial time for the future of our country. The Liberal Democrats are the clear force to fight against the extremism of the two main parties. If you back the values of tolerance and openness, join me in sending a message with your vote - and voting Liberal Democrat.

endorsements.endorsement: Don't settle for the appalling choice between Johnson and Corbyn. Use your vote to start something new.
Lord Heseltine, the former Conservative deputy prime minister, advises people to back the Lib Dems.
I'm impressed by Jo Swinson. I think if I was living in a lot of constituencies I would lend my vote to the Liberal Democrats.
I am worried about the Tory party... it is beginning to look like a Brexit sect.
I may protest and vote Lib Dem.

quotes.text: Don't settle for the appalling choice between Johnson and Corbyn. Use your vote to start something new.
I'm impressed by Jo Swinson. I think if I was living in a lot of constituencies I would lend my vote to the Liberal Democrats.
Lord Heseltine, the former Conservative deputy prime minister, advises people to back the Lib Dems.
quotes.source: Former Deputy PM Michael Heseltine, The Times, 26th Nov

quotes.text: I am worried about the Tory party... it is beginning to look like a Brexit sect.
quotes.source: Former Conservative MP and grandson of Churchill Nicholas Soames

quotes.text: I may protest and vote Lib Dem.
quotes.source: Former Conservative MP for nearly 50 years Ken Clarke

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is urging voters who traditionally voted Conservative to support the Liberal Democrats citing dissatisfaction with the direction the Conservative Party has taken under Boris Johnson.
